title: Exclusive: Brantley Gilbert On His 'Tough' Misconception | CMT Cody Alan | B100
text:
Exclusive: Brantley Gilbert On His 'Tough' Misconception posted by Dustin Stout - share 
Brantley Gilbert is strong in more ways than one. The country superstar got honest this week when he dropped by the CMT radio studio, revealing he long misunderstood the true meaning of “tough.”“For a long time in my like, I had a misconception of what being tough was,” Brantley says exclusively. “I thought being tough was all about being physically though, an intimidating figure, and being able to handle yourself physically ... I found out, through the years, that being morally though and spiritually tough is definitely more important. I want to surround myself with people who are morally and spiritually tough.” { "position1" : { "type" : "artist", "id" : 272271, "name" : "Brantley Gilbert" } } 
“The Weekend” singer and recovering alcoholic goes on to say he now surrounds himself with “people that are motivated and driven and also people that are morally strong.”Hear more of Cody’s with Brantley tonight on CMT Radio Live . Find when and where to listen here , or listen anytime on iHeartRadio . Pick up BG’s new album The Devil Don’t Sleep available everywhere now. 
Cody Alan is the Host and Executive Producer of radio shows: CMT After MidNite, CMT Radio Live and CMT All Access. Cody is also Host on TV of CMT's signature music show, Hot 20 Countdown , as well as Host of #1 Music and a Movie . 
Cody's radio shows are broadcast on stations across America and originate from Nashville. Cody's wit, energy and charm shine with big star guests and live interaction with listeners. Cody brings fans unprecedented access to all things current in country music and entertainment in an environment that's genuine, unpredictable and fun. Dierks Bentley says, "Cody's show always feels fresh and current. Cody cares about country music's past and future, and has always worked to make his shows exciting, interesting and personal." 
Recently named of one "Nashville's Most Beautiful People", catch Cody on Hot 20 Countdown on Saturday and Sunday mornings at 11am ET/10am CT. On weekends, catch Cody hosting #1 Music and a Movie on CMT . Cody was also recently the official voice of the CMT Music Awards . 
Cody is a respected veteran personality, producer and programmer in the broadcast industry, named the 2013 and 2010 National On-Air Personality of the Year by the Academy of Country Music. After gigs in South Carolina, Georgia and Florida, Cody made it to the major leagues at age 23 when he landed in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas. Along the way, Cody has received numerous national awards including DJ of the Year from Country Radio Broadcasters, and National On Air Personality of the Year at the ACMs. Cody has been honored at the Grand Ole Opry, featured in USA Today and GQ Magazine, and has been a contributor on E!News, CNN HLN, Country Weekly and in People Country. As well, Cody was named Radio and Records Music Director of the Year five times, while Billboard magazine and the Radio Music Awards honored him with the annual title as well. When not on radio or TV, Cody loves working out, running, watching reality shows, superhero movies, listening to all kinds of music, relaxing in the mountains, eating Mexican food and spending time with family and friends.
